image.altText: On the left, a picture of a man in a grey cap and white shirt smiling On the right, a man with a yellow shirt and a satchel

props.synopsis: Two men who killed Jakob Opacic in a "brutal and cruel" hit-and-run in the Gold Coast hinterland in 2021 have been sentenced in Brisbane.

title.children: Two men jailed for killing motorbike rider in 'brutal' hit-and-run in Gold Coast hinterland

image.altText: A graphic using shots of Ros Bates and Shannon Fentiman.

props.synopsis: A senior Queensland Opposition MP has been referred to a powerful parliamentary ethics committee after refusing to withdraw an accusation a minister had incited violence against her.

title.children: 'Cross your legs': Queensland MP provides context as she's referred to ethics committee over accusation

image.altText: Surgery theatre, green walls

props.synopsis: In some cases, policyholders have been hit with an increase as high as 17 per cent — experts say Australia's aging population may be to blame.

title.children: 'A snake eating its own tail': Some private health insurance policies have increased up to five times the approved average

image.altText: Peter Dutton at a press conference at EastCoast Beverages at Kulnura on NSW Central Coast.

props.synopsis: It's one thing to have an opinion when faced with a hypothetical. It's a completely different matter when that hypothetical becomes a reality, as is about to become the case in the communities Peter Dutton wants nuclear power plants built in.

title.children: When it comes to nuclear plans, the Coalition would do well to remember a toxic waste dump debacle

image.altText: A man walks with his head down

props.synopsis: A court heard the farmer had an "open door policy" for his workers, including when they were in the shower.

title.children: Farmer found guilty of raping backpacker worker at Queensland property

image.altText: The top of a power pole with hoses and greenery in the background.

props.synopsis: The energy regulator has decided to cap power prices in some markets, which is both good and bad news for Queenslanders.

title.children: New power price caps have been set by the energy regulator. Here's what it means for Queensland

image.altText: Rugby league player in a hoodie, arrives at a stadium

props.synopsis: Penrith's Taylan May and Manly's Brandon Wakeham are not allowed to take the field after the NRL enacted its no-fault stand down policy, which suspends players if they are charged with criminal offences that carry, if found guilty, maximum jail sentences of 11 or more years.

title.children: Taylan May stood down by NRL over domestic violence charges

image.altText: A man sitting on a stage wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Australia is at risk of "giving up on equity" if governments fail to reform housing and tax policies to improve the economic prospects of younger generations, according to Ross Garnaut, one of the country's most respected economists.

title.children: Leading economist Ross Garnaut says life was much easier for young people when he was their age. Here's why

image.altText: A composite image of a man and woman, both in their 70s

props.synopsis: An investigator shares the findings of human remains and personal effects recovered from a remote campsite in Victoria's High Country.

title.children: Forensic fire expert details human remains found at remote site in Greg Lynn murder trial

image.altText: A man in an orange high-vis uniform and helmet stands in front of a large truck and pile of rocks

props.synopsis: The fate of thousands of Queensland coal miners and their communities is in limbo, with BHP given a week to come back to the table with a better offer.

title.children: Anglo American rejects $74b BHP takeover bid, leaving Queensland miners in limbo

image.altText: Plibersek looks serious as she speaks to a camera in a corridor of parliament house.

props.synopsis: One of the federal government's most senior ministers Tanya Plibersek has raised concerns about a "continued epidemic of sexual assault amongst teenagers" if changes aren't made to how children access online content.

title.children: Minister fears an 'epidemic' of youth sexual assault driven by social media and easy-access pornography

image.altText: Ron Dermer speaks from a podium.

props.synopsis: One of Benjamin Netanyahu's top advisers has called allegations made against the Israeli prime minister "outrageous and libellous" while applauding Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: Dutton applauded by top Netanyahu advisor over proposal to cut ties with ICC

image.altText: A woman's sillhoute.

props.synopsis: "Institutionalised" underpayment of social services workers is rife, according to a new report, with many staff not knowing how much they should be getting paid.

title.children: 'It's like a dirty secret': Report reveals how family violence and social workers are being ripped off

image.altText: A man puts his arm around a woman, both standing on a walkway next to snowy hills

props.synopsis: Adelaide resident Jenny Hall, who was travelling on the Singapore Airlines flight which experienced extreme turbulence this week, says a decision to not go to the bathroom may have saved her from serious injury.

title.children: 'Blood on the roof': Couple recounts moment Singapore Airlines flight hit extreme turbulence

image.altText: Lieutenant General Stephen Sklenka addresses the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: A visiting American general insists Australia will not automatically be dragged into any future conflict with China despite growing integration between both militaries under the AUKUS partnership.

title.children: Australia won't be automatically dragged into future China conflicts, US general says

image.altText: A wide landscape shot of a large federation-era mansion at sunset. A garden, large tree and sloping driveway in the foreground

props.synopsis: The mammoth task of restoring Lamb House to its previous brilliance went millions of dollars over budget and finished years after it was expected to. But, its owners say they have "no regrets".

title.children: 'No regrets': Owners of iconic Brisbane mansion reveal results of mammoth restoration

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged man in a cap takes a selfie on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: The former bikie, now a podcast host, pleaded guilty to selling two bottles of CBD oil to undercover police on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Former Bandidos sergeant-at-arms Brent Simpson sentenced for selling CBD oil to police

image.altText: A home buyer looks at documents. In the foreground of the image is a model house and keys.

props.synopsis: Paying a mortgage is just one part of home ownership. Here are some of the other expenses to factor in.

title.children: The hidden costs of home ownership and why they're on the rise

image.altText: A Taiwan Air Force C-130 aircraft takes off at Hsinchu Air Base in Hsinchu

props.synopsis: China launches drills around Taiwan in response to "separatist acts", sending up heavily armed warplanes and staging mock attacks as state media denounced newly inaugurated President Lai Ching-te.

title.children: Furious China launches 'punishment' drills around Taiwan denouncing its newly inaugurated president

image.altText: Artists impressionnof a factory site.

props.synopsis: Green iron is made with renewable energy sources that do not release carbon dioxide, instead releasing water, making it as decarbonised as possible. This week, a company announced plans to build a facility in Gladstone and mine ore nearby.

title.children: 'World-leading' green iron facility to tap into nearby high-grade ore, green hydrogen development

image.altText: A slightly blurry screenshot shows a metal stage structure leaning at an awkward angle over a crowd, mid-collapse.

props.synopsis: The collapse occurred during an event in Nuevo Leon attended by presidential long-shot candidate Jorge Álvarez Máynez, who ran to escape.

title.children: Stage collapses at political rally in Mexico, killing at least nine people

image.altText: a phone screen showing an email from Optus that says "urgent updates"

props.synopsis: The details of millions of Optus customers were exposed when an offshore actor hacked its company database two years ago.

title.children: Optus to defend allegations it didn't properly protect its customers' details in a cyber attack

image.altText: Woman wearing protective face mask looks ahead next to picture of virus and vaccine injection.

props.synopsis: After a busy start to flu season, we're now bracing for new, highly transmissible COVID-causing subvariants.

title.children: Here's what you need to know about FLiRT, the new highly-transmissible COVID-causing variants

image.altText: A caravan park with cars and permanent shelters set up inside.

props.synopsis: Housing providers see more people forced into "filthy, unsafe, and overpriced" caravan parks on the New South Wales Central Coast as all other affordable options dry up.

title.children: The last resort: Families living in 'filthy' caravan parks as housing crisis hits coastal towns hard

image.altText: Four bodies suspended in blue liquid in cryogenics tanks.

props.synopsis: An unexpected dying request has resulted in a Sydney man being cryogenically frozen in a groundbreaking Australian move.

title.children: Sydney man becomes cryonics facility's first client, with hopes he will eventually be brought back to life

image.altText: A composite image of three people.

props.synopsis: Britain's general election didn't have to be held for another six months, but Rishi Sunak's announcement to call a snap July poll might point to how desperate things have become inside his Conservative Party.

title.children: Why Rishi Sunak's surprising early election announcement is a sign he's received some 'bleak news'

image.altText: A dark-skinned man in a white T-shirt and black backpack.

props.synopsis: Up to 12 Australians who were on the London-to-Singapore flight that suffered extreme turbulence this week remain in two hospitals in Bangkok.

title.children: Three Australians in intensive care in Thai hospitals as more Singapore Airlines passengers begin journeys home

image.altText: Laptop on desk with chatGPT displayed on screen

props.synopsis: AI chatbots are making it easier for people to write legal documents without the help of a lawyer, leading the courts to release advice on the benefits and pitfalls.

title.children: AI is helping people add 'flourish' to legal documents without the help of a lawyer

image.altText: A woman in sunglasses wears a broadbrimmed hat crawling with hundreds of flies.

props.synopsis: An "absolutely shocking" number of bush flies has caught both locals and visitors to the Gascoyne off guard, with a hot summer followed by a mild autumn blamed for the outbreak.

title.children: 'Ridiculous' fly plague hits central Western Australia

image.altText: A man wearing a black suit and blue tie

props.synopsis: Mark Latham's lawyer admits a tweet that prompted independent Sydney MP Alex Greenwich to sue the ex-One Nation NSW leader caused almost universal revulsion, but has argued it wasn't defamatory.

title.children: Mark Latham's tweet to Sydney MP was vulgar and shocking, but not defamatory, court hears

image.altText: A young man and woman hug beside a wrecked home, on which someone has tied an American flag.

props.synopsis: One tornado which tore through the centre of the small town of Greenfield, south-west of Des Moines, left a wide trail of obliterated homes, splintered trees and crumpled cars, before bringing down turbines at a nearby wind farm.

title.children: Five dead, at least 35 hurt as tornadoes rip through Iowa, destroying wind turbines

image.altText: A flat lay of a calculator, an electricity bill and a mobile phone displaying an ABC article about electricity prices.

props.synopsis: Embattled electricity consumers are set for modest relief after energy regulators cut benchmark power prices in most states.

title.children: Power pain to ease as regulator hands down modest price relief

image.altText: A service station employee wearing a green shirt stands in front of a shelf

props.synopsis: Fijian nationals working in Australian service stations say it's a "blessing" as the hospitality and retail sectors are next in line to recruit staff from Pacific nations.

title.children: A servo owner had trouble finding locals to work. Pacific workers gladly filled the gaps
